title: The Best Commuter Bags for Hybrid Work, When Your Load Is 10 Pounds Heavier
sub_head: From gym shoes and chargers to books, cutlery and laptops, workers without permanent desks now carry a lot more back and forth each day. Here, our five top picks to schlep it all.
body:
As workers trickle back into offices that, in many cases, now consist of unassigned, socially distanced “hot desks,” they’re confronting more than a sense of dislocation. Namely the realization of how much they once relied on their under-desk filing cabinets to stash spare gym shoes, cutlery, chargers, mugs, water bottles and laptops overnight.
Now, “we have to carry our computers and work back and forth each day,” said Ashley Wray, 26, a nonprofit worker in St. Charles, Mo. When her workplace adopted a hybrid model, she quickly discovered that the small handbag she relied on pre-pandemic wouldn’t hold the books, planners and files she needed and upgraded to a large backpack with a laptop sleeve and an oversize pocket.
